header: CANADA STOCKS-TSX ends higher as Valeant offsets weakness in resources
body:
TORONTO, Aug 4 (Reuters) - Canada’s main stock index rose on Tuesday as strength in shares of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc helped offset a decline in the energy and mining sectors.

The Toronto Stock Exchange’s S&P/TSX composite index closed up 22.61 points, or 0.16 percent, at 14,491.05. (Reporting by John Tilak; Editing by James Dalgleish)
